data.title: Rectangular block spinner
data.solution:
<?php
fscanf(STDIN, "%d", $size);
fscanf(STDIN, "%d", $angle);
for ($i = 0; $i < $size; $i++) {
    $matrix[] = explode(" ", stream_get_line(STDIN, 1024 + 1, "\n"));
}
//---------------------------------------------------------------------------
while( ($angle -= 90) > 0) {
    $matrix = call_user_func_array(
        'array_map',
        [-1 => null] + array_map('array_reverse', $matrix)
    );
}

// dimond shape generate
$rotation = [];
for ($i = -$size; $i < $size; $i++) {
    $rotatedRow = [];
    for ($y = $i, $x = 0; $y < $size*2 && $x < $size*2; $y++, $x++) {
        if (isset($matrix[$y][$x])) {
            $rotatedRow[] = $matrix[$y][$x];
        }
    }
    if ($rotatedRow) {
        $rotation[] = $rotatedRow;
    }
}

// Shine Bright like a Dimond
foreach($rotation as $row) {
    echo ($space = str_repeat(' ', $size-count($row))).implode(" ", $row)."{$space}\n";
}
data.statement: You have to rotate [[size]]X[[size]] block counterclockwise by an angle [[angle]].  The block is filled with single ASCII characters. Angle is provided in degrees and is an odd multiple of 45.  The output will always have a diamond shape.

read size:int
read angle:int
loop size read line:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
Line 1: Size of the block, [[size]].
Line 2: Angle [[angle]].
[[size]] following lines: Content of the block. ASCII characters are separated with spaces.
data.outputDescription: Rotated block with spaces on both ends.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to rotate sizeXsize block counterclockwise by an angle angle. The block is filled with single ASCII characters. Angle is provided in degrees and is an odd multiple of 45. The output will always have a diamond shape.
Input
Line 1: Size of the block, size.
Line 2: Angle angle.
size following lines: Content of the block. ASCII characters are separated with spaces.
Output
Rotated block with spaces on both ends.
Constraints
2 <= size <= 100
45 <= angle <= 2295
angle % 90 == 45 (Dimond shape)
Example
Input
5
45
# # # # #
# - . . #
# # - . #
# # # - #
# # # # #
Output
    #    
   # #   
  # . #  
 # . . # 
# - - - #
 # # # # 
  # # #  
   # #   
    #
